books.title: Deep Learning
books.author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville
books.notes: Foundational deep learning textbook covering neural networks, optimization, and practical applications.

books.title: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow
books.author: Aurélien Géron
books.notes: Practical guide to machine learning with real-world examples and production tips.

books.title: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
books.author: Christopher Bishop
books.notes: Comprehensive coverage of statistical pattern recognition and machine learning fundamentals.

books.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
books.author: Martin Kleppmann
books.notes: Essential reading for understanding distributed systems and data architecture.

books.title: Clean Code
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.notes: Principles for writing maintainable and readable code.

books.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
books.author: David Thomas, Andrew Hunt
books.notes: Currently reading - timeless advice for software development.

books.title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
books.author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig
books.notes: Comprehensive textbook covering the breadth of AI from search algorithms to neural networks.

books.title: The Master Algorithm
books.author: Pedro Domingos
books.notes: Accessible overview of the five tribes of machine learning and the quest for a universal learner.

books.title: Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
books.author: Max Tegmark
books.notes: Explores the future of AI and its impact on consciousness, work, and society.

books.title: Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies
books.author: Nick Bostrom
books.notes: Examines the existential risks and challenges of artificial superintelligence.

books.title: The Code Breaker
books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.notes: Biography of Jennifer Doudna and the story of CRISPR gene editing.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.notes: Practical framework for building good habits and breaking bad ones.

books.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.notes: Groundbreaking insights into human decision-making and cognitive biases.

books.title: The Lean Startup
books.author: Eric Ries
books.notes: Methodology for developing businesses and products through validated learning.

books.title: Zero to One
books.author: Peter Thiel
books.notes: Notes on startups and building the future through innovation.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.notes: Sweeping narrative of human evolution, culture, and civilization.

books.author: George Orwell
books.notes: Classic dystopian novel about surveillance, totalitarianism, and truth.

books.title: Neuromancer
books.author: William Gibson
books.notes: Cyberpunk classic that defined the genre and predicted the internet age.

books.title: The Phoenix Project
books.author: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, George Spafford
books.notes: Novel about IT, DevOps, and helping businesses win through technology.

books.title: Algorithms to Live By
books.author: Brian Christian, Tom Griffiths
books.notes: Applies computer science concepts to everyday life decisions.

papers.title: Attention Is All You Need
papers.notes: The foundational transformer paper that revolutionized NLP and beyond.

papers.title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers
You Only Look Once: Unified, Real-Time Object Detection
papers.notes: Revolutionary approach to real-time object detection.

papers.title: Generative Adversarial Networks
papers.notes: Introduced the GAN framework for generative modeling.

papers.title: Wav2Vec 2.0: A Framework for Self-Supervised Learning of Speech Representations
